required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Research Study Looking at the Comparability (Bioequivalence) of Two Forms of Semaglutide in Two Different Pen-injectors in People With Overweight or Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial to Demonstrate Bioequivalence Between Semaglutide Formulation D With the DV3396 Pen-injector and Formulation B With the PDS290 Pen-injector in Subjects With Overweight or Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: The study will look at how two different forms of semaglutide reach and stay in the blood after injection. None of the two forms of semaglutide have been approved by the authorities to treat obesity, but it has been approved as a treatment for diabetes mellitus. Participants will get 1 of the 2 forms of semaglutide - which one is decided by chance. Participants will get the medicine as an injection under the skin of the belly using a pen-injector. The type of pen-injector is different for the two forms of semaglutide. The study staff will teach participants how to inject the medicine. Participants will take an injection once a week and will get a total of 21 injections of study medication. The study will last for about 27-30 weeks. Participants will have 25 study visits with the study doctor. For 2 of the visits, participants will stay in the clinic for 3 days and 2 nights. Participants may have to stop the study if the study doctor thinks that there are risks for their health. Women cannot take part if they are pregnant, breast-feeding or planning to become pregnant during the study period.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-168h,2.4mg,SS, Area under the semaglutide concentration time curve

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-168h,1mg,SS, Area under the semaglutide concentration time curve
Tmax,2.4mg,SS, Time of maximum observed semaglutide concentration after last 2.4 mg dose
Tmax,1mg,SS, Time of maximum observed semaglutide concentration after last 1 mg dose
tÂ½, terminal elimination half-life of semaglutide after last 2.4 mg dose
Cl/F2.4mg, Total apparent clearance of semaglutide after last 2.4 mg dose
Cl/F1mg, Total apparent clearance of semaglutide after last 1 mg dose
Vss/F2.4mg, Apparent volume of distribution at steady-state of semaglutide after last 2.4 mg dose
Vss/F1mg, Apparent volume of distribution at steady-state of semaglutide after last 1 mg dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (Day 1, pre-dose) until the end of treatment

arm_group.description: Semaglutide administered with the DV3396 pen-injector (Formulation D)
Semaglutide administered with the PDS290 pen-injector (Formulation B)

intervention.description: Increasing doses of semaglutide administered s.c. (subcutaneouly, under the skin) once weekly for 20 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, aged 18-65 years (both inclusive) at the time of signing informed consent
- Body mass index (BMI) between 27.0 and 34.9 kg/m^2 (both inclusive)
- Body weight between 70.0 and 130.0 kg (both inclusive)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female who is pregnant, breast-feeding or intends to become pregnant or is of child-bearing potential and not using a highly effective contraceptive method
- Any disorder which in the investigator's opinion might jeopardise subject's safety or compliance with the protocol
- Inability or unwillingness to perform self-injection

patient_data.ipd_description: According to the Novo Nordisk disclosure commitment on novonordisk-trials.com
